2049bbecf632ca876224dd4b2","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://6a708e8a5bdb1011c2c381c9a5cfd8a9a956d7d0a9dc1bd8bcdaf52f76ef2f12","dweb:/ipfs/Qmax9WHBnVsZP46ZxEMNRQpLQnrdE4dK8LehML1Py8FowF"]},"node_modules/@routerprotocol/evm-gateway-contracts/contracts/IDapp.sol":{"keccak256":"0x607068d2b816bddcaea2869e2747a775bba5c7f772a6cb1649420e3cb68444e7","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://fe440787fabb1e9b83586620d8ad0469b46bbfc14c09dc2160c99c73d6fd5c6e","dweb:/ipfs/QmZyf8Ze6mXiQKKYViKToXMHbWc9JMdUk1BGUgJskYvuR7"]},"node_modules/@routerprotocol/evm-gateway-contracts/contracts/IGateway.sol":{"keccak256":"0x6fe9394a370afbf8dcc159fcd0a4c3e672d4b229519147ee93dc540e1e1585d6","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://65aca8a59b5e0617af8c7cdc7d65f5c0058d90d691174812e1578cf1b27b6a3b","dweb:/ipfs/QmXZoZaMxdGxCFxiPTbUAbankZUgkhMmL2W1FttM2bShg6"]},"node_modules/@routerprotocol/evm-gateway-contracts/contracts/Utils.sol":{"keccak256":"0xe85303a39e17722ffadec7eaf63d76dd6f4abb35904f810a2566dd7d0496b3ad","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://047e54b434b8c4c045ad0e87c80a619713620512adbcdf73e7fcc258d3654279","dweb:/ipfs/Qmd4CV1gwoQBoh5jGZzU8pVJ1wkJsoNiXjq12njTdkr99t"]},"src/XERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0x570097ebe8244ab3afca684235e87968894c0dfde21c160cc0b3691ec0240759","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://befc9d9997a63457bdca12214697a825aa76bc7ca29441ca5ad211c5d3361240","dweb:/ipfs/QmR6NDsSJzvjtLxijghpQbtdVXadN1bhYy1ZNbk66i5yAF"]}},"version":1}

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `value` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless it's overridden. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

params.execData: returning the data returned from the handleRequestFromSource function of the destination chain.
params.execFlag: a boolean value suggesting whether the call was successfully executed on the destination chain.
params.requestIdentifier: event nonce which is received when we create a cross-chain request.

params.packet: the payload sent by the source chain contract when the request was created.
params.srcChainId: chain ID of the source chain in string.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

params.chainId: chain Id of the destination chain in string.
params.contractAddress: address of the NFT contract on the destination chain.

params.feePayerAddress: address of the fee payer on Router Chain.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `value`.

params.destChainId: chain ID of the destination chain in string.
params.recipient: recipient address on the destination chain in bytes format.
params.requestMetadata: abi-encoded metadata according to source and destination chains.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Skips emitting an {Approval} event indicating an allowance update. This is not required by the ERC. See {xref-ERC20-_approve-address-address-uint256-bool-}[_approve]. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `value`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `value`.

params.destChainId: chain ID of the destination chain in string.
params.recipient: recipient address on the destination chain in bytes format.
params.requestMetadata: abi-encoded metadata according to source and destination chains.

iAck(uint256,bool,bytes).notice: function to handle the acknowledgement received from the destination chain.

iReceive(string,bytes,string).notice: function to handle the cross-chain request received from some other chain.

setContractOnChain(string,string).notice: function to set the address of our NFT contracts on different chains. This will help in access control when a cross-chain request is received.

setDappMetadata(string).notice: function to set the fee payer address on Router Chain.

transferFromCrossChain(string,uint256,by.notice: function to transfer tokens cross-chain on behalf of a user.
